heroSlides.title: Reborn To Move Fearless
heroSlides.subtitle: Your path out of pain starts with science driven care.

heroSlides.title: Science Driven Care
heroSlides.subtitle: Evidence-based reasoning and management for lasting recovery.

heroSlides.title: Expert Rehabilitation
heroSlides.subtitle: Helping you return to an active, confident, and pain-free life.

valueProps.title: Assessment First Approach
valueProps.desc: A structured evaluation to understand the real cause instead of chasing symptoms.
valueProps.description: We don't guess. We assess. Before any treatment begins, we conduct a comprehensive evaluation to understand not just 'where' it hurts, but 'why' it hurts.
details: Goal setting aligned with your lifestyle

valueProps.title: Patient Centred Personalised Treatment
valueProps.desc: Treatment plans designed around your specific needs, goals, and lifestyle.
valueProps.description: You are the expert on your body. We are the experts on movement. Together, we co-create a plan that fits your life, creating sustainable habits.

valueProps.title: Exercise Science Centred Rehabilitation
valueProps.desc: Building movement control, stability and confidence before adding load.
valueProps.description: Rest doesn't fix everything. Structured, progressive loading is the key to tissue adaptation and long-term resilience.

valueProps.title: Evidence Based Reasoning
valueProps.desc: Using current clinical evidence and biomechanics to guide every decision.
valueProps.description: We stay updated with the latest research to ensure your care is effective, proven, and devoid of pseudoscience.

valueProps.title: Clear, Progressive Treatment Planning
valueProps.desc: A plan that continues beyond pain relief to build resilience and independence.
valueProps.description: Rehabilitation shouldn't be a cycle of dependency. We give you a clear roadmap from pain to performance.

valueProps.title: Movement & Biomechanics
valueProps.desc: Observing how you move so patterns, compensations and irritants become clear.
valueProps.description: Pain is often a symptom of poor movement mechanics. We use advanced video analysis and biomechanical reasoning to correct the root cause.

founders.name: Dr. Swatheeshwaran
founders.bio: Dr. Swatheeshwaran is an evidence-aligned physiotherapist specialising in movement-based rehabilitation, capacity building and clinical reasoning for musculoskeletal and sport-related conditions. His approach is assessment-first and exercise-centred, focusing on progressive loading, movement tolerance and functional recovery rather than passive symptom relief.
founders.subBio: With experience as an Assistant Professor in physiotherapy and as a clinician working with athletes across competitive levels, he integrates academic rigour with real-world sports rehabilitation. His work supports patients and athletes in understanding their condition, adapting to load and returning to meaningful activity with confidence.

award.title: Award & Recognition
award.content: Awarded the Young Achiever Alumni Award 2025 by SRM College of Physiotherapy, SRM Institute of Science and Technology (SRMIST), in recognition of contributions to physiotherapy practice and sports rehabilitation.

clinicalBackground.title: Clinical Background
clinicalBackground.intro: Dr. Swatheeshwaran has worked as an On-Field Physiotherapist and Rehabilitation Provider for Major Sporting Events between 2021 and 2024, including:
events: TNBA Basketball Championships (Junior, Senior and State Levels)
South Zone Inter-University Football, Volleyball, Tennis and Basketball Tournaments
clinicalBackground.academic: His academic role as an Assistant Professor strengthened his expertise in biomechanics, exercise physiology, evidence-based assessment and clinical reasoning.

philosophy.title: Clinical Philosophy
philosophy.content: Recovery and performance are built through physical capacity, not passive care. Dr. Swatheeshwaran emphasises assessment-first evaluation, clear clinical reasoning, exercise-centred rehabilitation and progressive load exposure. Passive modalities such as manual therapy, dry needling and cupping are not used as primary treatment.

approach.title: Approach With Patients
approach.content: Care is collaborative, clear and goal-oriented. Each plan is tailored to individual needs, focusing on building strength, endurance and confidence in movement, and supporting safe return to sport, work and daily activities based on readiness and tolerance.

services.title: Pain-Informed Physiotherapy
services.excerpt: Understanding pain behaviour and movement tolerance to restore confidence and functional capacity.
services.description: Pain is complex and does not always reflect tissue damage. It is influenced by movement tolerance, loading patterns, previous experiences and activity demands.
services.fullDescription: Addressing pain effectively requires understanding how the body responds to movement and load rather than focusing only on symptoms. Our care begins with a detailed assessment of pain behaviour, activity limitations and movement tolerance. Treatment focuses on education, progressive exercise and graded exposure to movement to improve confidence and functional capacity. Rehabilitation is adapted based on individual response rather than pain alone.
benefits: Reduced dependence on medication and passive care
process: Pain and activity history to understand symptom behaviour
Movement assessment to identify tolerance and protective strategies
Education to clarify pain mechanisms and reduce uncertainty
Graded exercise exposure to restore movement confidence

details.feels: Complex pain patterns, movement fear, or persistent symptoms.
details.expect: A science-backed explanation of your pain and a clear path to movement confidence.
details.approach: Care begins with a detailed assessment of pain behaviour, activity limitations and movement tolerance. Treatment focuses on education, progressive exercise and graded exposure to movement.

services.title: Sports Physiotherapy & Rehabilitation
services.excerpt: Sport-specific conditioning and capacity profiling to ensure a safe return to competition.
services.description: Sports injuries require more than symptom resolution. Athletes need sufficient strength, endurance and load tolerance to safely return to training.
services.fullDescription: Inadequate preparation increases the risk of recurrence. Our rehabilitation is guided by the physical demands of the sport. Assessment focuses on movement patterns, strength capacity and load tolerance. Training is progressed through sport-specific conditioning based on readiness rather than timelines.

details.feels: Reduced performance, fear of re-injury, or need for sport-specific loading.
details.expect: A return-to-play plan based on objective readiness metrics.
details.approach: Rehabilitation is guided by the physical demands of the sport. Assessment focuses on movement patterns, strength capacity and load tolerance.

services.title: Post-Surgical Physiotherapy Rehabilitation
services.excerpt: Guided recovery focused on restoring movement, strength, and functional tolerance post-surgery.
services.description: Surgery addresses structural issues but does not automatically restore movement or function. Rehab is essential to regain capacity safely.
services.fullDescription: Post-surgical rehabilitation focuses on restoring movement, strength and functional tolerance. Progression is guided by tissue healing, individual response and activity demands rather than fixed milestones. We bridge the gap between clinical healing and return to full life.
process: Gradual restoration of movement and control

details.feels: Post-operative stiffness, weakness, or uncertainty about movement limits.
details.expect: Structured phases of recovery that respect tissue healing timelines.
details.approach: Post-surgical rehabilitation focuses on restoring movement, strength and functional tolerance. Progression is guided by tissue healing.

services.title: Spine Care Physiotherapy
services.excerpt: Movement-based spine care focusing on improving tolerance, trunk strength and functional capacity.
services.description: Neck and back pain are often influenced by movement tolerance and activity confidence rather than structural damage alone.
services.fullDescription: Avoiding movement can prolong symptoms. Our spine care is movement-based and focuses on improving tolerance, trunk strength and functional capacity. Education and graded exposure help restore confidence and reduce fear associated with movement.
process: Assessment of movement, tolerance and daily demands
Education to reduce fear and uncertainty
Functional integration into daily or sport activities

details.feels: Back or neck stiffness, difficulty lifting, or fear of bending.
details.expect: Strategies to manage daily loads and rebuild spinal resilience.
details.approach: Spine care is movement-based and focuses on improving tolerance, trunk strength and functional capacity.

services.title: Knee & Shoulder Physiotherapy
services.excerpt: Individualised rehabilitation for load-dependent joints, focusing on progressive strengthening.
services.description: The knee and shoulder are highly load-dependent joints. Pain often reflects reduced tolerance to strength and activity demands.
services.fullDescription: Pain often reflects reduced tolerance to strength and activity demands rather than isolated structural damage. Rehabilitation focuses on progressive strengthening, movement control and functional loading. Programs are individualised based on tolerance and task demands.
benefits: Improved performance in daily tasks and sport
process: Movement control and basic strength development

details.feels: Instability, overhead pain, or knee discomfort during stairs/squats.
details.expect: A clear progression of loading tailored to your joint's capacity.
details.approach: Rehabilitation focuses on progressive strengthening, movement control and functional loading.

services.title: Performance Support & Conditioning
services.excerpt: Strength, endurance and cardiac capacity development to support long-term performance resilience.
services.description: Performance depends on strength, endurance and the ability to tolerate training loads. Poor conditioning increases breakdown.
services.fullDescription: Our performance support focuses on developing strength, endurance and cardiac capacity to support training demands. Programs complement sport training and are adapted based on response and recovery to ensure long-term resilience.
process: Integration with sport or activity demands

details.feels: Plateaued progress, frequent fatigue, or desire to reach next level capacity.
details.expect: Scientifically periodized training that respects your primary sport demands.
details.approach: Performance support focuses on developing strength, endurance and cardiac capacity to support training demands.

services.title: Online Physiotherapy Consultations
services.excerpt: Remote assessment, education and guided exercise planning for convenient expert care.
services.description: Some conditions can be effectively managed through remote assessment, education and guided exercise.
services.fullDescription: Online care improves access when in-clinic visits are not immediately required. Online consultations focus on history taking, movement review, education and exercise planning. We ensure a seamless transition to in-clinic care if required.
benefits: Continued progress when travel is limited
Seamless transition to in-clinic care if required

details.feels: Need for expert advice but unable to travel or live far from the clinic.
details.expect: The same clinical reasoning and exercise science, delivered digitally.
details.approach: Online consultations focus on history taking, movement review, education and exercise planning.

conditions.title: Knee Pain
conditions.whatItIs: Pain arising from the joint, soft tissues or loading mechanics around the knee.
conditions.symptoms: Pain during walking, squatting, stairs or sport activities.
conditions.whenToSeekHelp: If pain limits daily activity or keeps recurring.

conditions.title: Back Pain
conditions.whatItIs: Pain from spinal joints, discs or soft tissue sensitivity influenced by load and movement.
conditions.symptoms: Stiffness, tightness, sharp episodes or discomfort with bending and lifting.
conditions.whenToSeekHelp: If pain affects work, sleep or daily function.

conditions.title: Neck Pain
conditions.whatItIs: Pain arising from cervical joints, muscles or load intolerance.
conditions.symptoms: Difficulty turning, tightness, headaches or radiating discomfort.
conditions.whenToSeekHelp: If symptoms persist or limit movement.

conditions.title: Shoulder Pain
conditions.whatItIs: Pain from rotator cuff tissues, joint structures or movement coordination issues.
conditions.symptoms: Pain during lifting, reaching, overhead tasks or sleep.

conditions.title: Ankle Injuries
conditions.whatItIs: Sprains or load related issues affecting ankle stability and movement control.
conditions.symptoms: Swelling, instability or pain during walking or sport.

conditions.title: Ligament Injuries
conditions.whatItIs: Injury to stabilising ligaments in joints like the knee or ankle.
conditions.symptoms: Instability, swelling or difficulty with weight bearing and sport.
conditions.whenToSeekHelp: If the joint feels unstable or recovery slows.

conditions.title: Muscle Strains
conditions.whatItIs: Injury to muscle fibres due to sudden effort or excessive load.
conditions.symptoms: Local pain, tightness, reduced strength or discomfort on stretch.
conditions.whenToSeekHelp: If pain limits movement or sport performance.

conditions.title: Sciatica
conditions.whatItIs: Radiating leg pain due to neural sensitivity or spinal mechanics.
conditions.symptoms: Leg pain, numbness, tingling or difficulty with prolonged standing or walking.
conditions.whenToSeekHelp: If symptoms persist or worsen over time.

snapshots.title: Bavithra P - Basketball
snapshots.short_description: Professional basketball player Bavithra overcomes Grade 2 ACL injury without surgery through dedicated rehab.
snapshots.article:
I am a professional basketball player since 2013. I’ve played in various tournaments, and I love my sport, but in 2021 I had a major injury. It was a Grade 2 ACL and Grade 1 Lateral Collateral Ligament injury. I didn’t go for surgery because I was scared it would cause more problems, so I relied completely on rehab. It worked for some time, but not for long, and I got injured again. I was honestly on the verge of giving up when I met Mr. Swatheeshwaran sir.

Most physios will just say “eat this and do this exercise,” but he analysed everything — even small things like my sleeping pattern and eating habits — and everything he said actually made sense. That’s when I realised the minor things I ignored were bringing the biggest impact.

He started monitoring my improvements, my diet plan and the entire rehab process, and within just two months I saw massive improvement in my health and physique. Because of him, I was able to get up and play my favourite sport again. And the impact is still there.

He’s the one who made me understand what the word “proper diet” really means, and I’m still following it to stay healthy. I’m really thankful that he always made sure I improved. He never hesitated to help, always made time to interact with me and go through my progress.

Thank you for your wonderful efforts and insights, sir.

seo.title: Bavithra P - Basketball ACL Recovery | Success Stories | Atreus Physio
seo.description: Professional basketball player Bavithra P shares her journey of recovering from Grade 2 ACL injury without surgery at Atreus Physio.
seo.author: Dr. Swatheeshwaran

snapshots.title: Marimuthu N A - Pro Kabaddi
snapshots.short_description: Pro Kabaddi player Marimuthu returns to the mat after recovering from an MCL knee injury.
snapshots.article:
Hi, I’m Marimuthu. I play for SRM University Chennai, and I’ve also played Pro Kabaddi S9. I’ve represented the Tamil Nadu team 6 times and have won All India Inter University medals too.

During the 2024, I got injured in my left knee during a competition. They told me it was a knee issue, so I went to meet sir.

Sir treated me, gave me pain relief load management and strengthening exercises. I did everything properly, and my pain went away completely. He kept giving me daily strength exercises and that helped me get back to playing faster.

Sir told me injuries are common for sports players and also kept motivating me mentally. Because of that, I felt a lot of hope and I was able to return to play confidently.

seo.title: Marimuthu N A - Pro Kabaddi | Success Stories | Atreus Physio
seo.description: Pro Kabaddi player Marimuthu returns to the mat after recovering from an MCL knee injury with expert physio care in Trichy.
seo.author: Dr. Swatheeshwaran

snapshots.title: Vimal - Volleyball
snapshots.short_description: Volleyball player Vimal finds relief from 3 years of chronic shoulder pain in just 1 month.
snapshots.article:
Hi, I’m Vimal, a volleyball player. I’m now appointed and working in Railways. I injured my shoulder back in school, and all through college for almost 3 years I had pain and disturbance while playing. I visited multiple physios and tried self-managing with ice, but nothing cured it. I couldn’t perform at 100 percent in games. Other physios just gave UST and basic treatments, so I eventually lost hope in going to physio at all.

Finally, through a referral from my friend, I met Mr. Swatheeshwaran sir. I got confidence the moment I spoke with him. He understood my pain and my condition right away, analysed everything clearly and explained it to me in a way that made complete sense. I gained confidence through that and started attending regular rehab under his advice.

After 2 years of struggling with pain, I finally got out of pain in just 1 month of physio sessions with sir. Until now, I’m functioning without pain or re-injury by following the advice he gave me. I’m still continuing the exercises he taught me. He also taught me how to prepare before games to avoid re-injury and how to warm up properly. I still follow those protocols in my routine.

I’m really grateful for the help he gave me, because I had completely lost hope until I met him.

seo.title: Vimal - Volleyball Shoulder Pain Recovery | Success Stories
seo.description: Volleyball player Vimal overcomes 3 years of chronic shoulder pain with specialized sports physiotherapy at Atreus Physio.
seo.author: Dr. Swatheeshwaran

snapshots.title: Aditi - Basketball
snapshots.short_description: Basketball player Aditi overcomes chronic ankle pain with a structured strengthening program.
snapshots.article:
I started playing basketball from 4th standard onwards. I played for long time but during my U16 states my left ankle got injured. And after 3 to 4 years my ankle pain got little severe and according to my coach I took advice and consulted to the sir and got my proper strengthening for ankle pain.

The exercise program they gave me was easy to follow, well structured, and really effective, I noticed improvement much faster than I expected. They checked in on my progress, adjusted exercises when needed and made sure I felt confident doing them on my own.

I prefer everyone to consult with them for any pain and injury.

seo.title: Aditi - Basketball Ankle Rehab | Success Stories
seo.description: Basketball player Aditi shares her experience of recovering from chronic ankle pain through strengthening exercises at Atreus Physio.
seo.author: Dr. Swatheeshwaran

snapshots.title: Mrs. Ameena
snapshots.short_description: Mrs. Ameena finds effective pain management and long-term recovery for Chondromalacia Patella.
snapshots.article:
I had been dealing with knee pain due to chondromalacia patella, and consulting Mr. Swatheswaran turned out to be one of the best decisions.

His approach to treatment was very well planned, focusing on effective pain management along with the right strengthening exercises for long-term recovery.

He explained the condition clearly, monitored my progress closely, and customized the exercises based on my comfort and improvement.

Thanks to his expertise and guidance, my knee pain has reduced significantly and my strength and mobility have improved a lot.

I truly appreciate his dedication and professionalism and would highly recommend him to anyone looking for a knowledgeable and reliable physiotherapist.

seo.title: Mrs. Ameena - Knee Pain Relief | Success Stories
seo.description: Mrs. Ameena finds relief from Chondromalacia Patella and knee pain through personalized physiotherapy and expert care.
seo.author: Dr. Swatheeshwaran
